paragraphs.body: Bowen was born in Ohio and is one of six siblings, all of whom are performers, including his younger sister, Andrea Bowen.
paragraphs.text: Bowen was born in Ohio and is one of six siblings, all of whom are performers, including his younger sister, Andrea Bowen.

paragraphs.body: Bowen began his acting career in New York as "Poor Baby" in the musical Whistle Down the Wind. Subsequent Broadway credits include Jojo in Seussical the Musical, opposite Rosie O'Donnell and Cathy Rigby, Gavroche in Les Misérables, and Chip in Beauty and the Beast. He also played "Little Jake" in a Lincoln Center performance of Annie Get Your Gun and starred as Tom Canty, the Pauper, in the highly acclaimed production of The Prince and The Pauper. In addition to his other TV credits, he was the voice of "Bob the Ball" on HBO's A Little Curious and Periwinkle on Blue's Clues.

Subsequent Broadway credits include Jojo in Seussical the Musical, opposite Rosie O'Donnell and Cathy Rigby, Gavroche in Les Misérables, and Chip in Beauty and the Beast. He also played "Little Jake" in a Lincoln Center performance of Annie Get Your Gun and starred as Tom Canty, the Pauper, in the highly acclaimed production of The Prince and The Pauper. In addition to his other TV credits, he was the voice of "Bob the Ball" on HBO's A Little Curious and Periwinkle on Blue's Clues.
